dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/903142654 at Thu Dec 10 14:42:22 UTC 2020

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="pages"}),
  1
)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: Error Ratios

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="pages"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="pages"})

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: loadbalancer SLI Error-Rate

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="pages"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="pages"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: loadbalancer SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI models requests passing through the loadbalancer in front of the pages service.
5xx requests for unencrypted HTTP traffic, and connection errors (not 5xx requests) for
HTTPS traffic are considered to be errors. The loadbalancer is unable to determine the
status code of HTTPS traffic as it passes through the loadbalancer encrypted.
panels.title: Details

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="disk_inodes"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="pages", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", type="pages", stage=~"|$stage"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or

or

or

or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="pages", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="pages", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_jvm_heap_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_jvm_heap_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_single_node_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_single_node_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_node_disk_space", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_thread_pools", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_thread_pools", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="go_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_go_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_container_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_container_cpu", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_container_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_container_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_hpa_instances", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_hpa_instances", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_persistent_volume_claim_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_pvc_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="kube_persistent_volume_claim_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_kube_pvc_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="memory", alert_dashboard="sat_memory", severity="s4"})
or

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        type="pages", stage=~"|$stage"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          type="pages", stage=~"|$stage"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})

or

or

absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_disk_space", severity="s3"})

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="pages",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"$stage|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph lb
  pages
end

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage"}),
  1
)

panels.title: System Diagram (Keyed by Error Rates)

panels.content:
graph TD
  subgraph lb
  pages
end
